quote_first: The buzz of nervous chatter ceased at
quote_last: when a tall, elegant man in morning dress entered the room, came to a halt at the foot of the step, and turned to face the assembled gathering.
quote_raw: The buzz of nervous chatter ceased at six minutes to eleven when a tall, elegant man in morning dress entered the room, came to a halt at the foot of the step, and turned to face the assembled gathering.
title: This Was a Man
author: Jeffrey Archer

quote_last:
"Commander Hawksby's office."
"It's Bruce Lamont, Angela. Can you put me through to the boss?"
"He's still in Italy, Bruce. I'm not expecting him back until Monday."
quote_raw:
10:54 GMT
"Commander Hawksby's office."
"It's Bruce Lamont, Angela. Can you put me through to the boss?"
"He's still in Italy, Bruce. I'm not expecting him back until Monday."
title: Nothing Ventured
author: Jeffrey Archer

quote_last: Her telephone call would come in a minute. They were at different times each morning and she had a plastic laminated chart that told her what time to expect the call on each day.
quote_raw: It was 10:54 A.M. Her telephone call would come in a minute. They were at different times each morning and she had a plastic laminated chart that told her what time to expect the call on each day.
title: Last Call
author: Warren Murphy and Richard Sapir

quote_first: I'm telling you that you paid 6,495 into Bennington's Bank in the High Street at
quote_last:
today, insisted Frost.
"And I'm telling you I did not" spat the man.
quote_raw:
I'm telling you that you paid 6,495 into Bennington's Bank in the High Street at 10:54 a.m. today, insisted Frost.
"And I'm telling you I did not" spat the man.
title: Hard Frost
author: R.D. Wingfield
